name: Neo4j
title: A Neo4j cheat sheet with getting started resources and information on how to query the database with Cypher.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: A Neo4j cheat sheet with getting started resources and information on how to query the database with Cypher.

cards.title: Getting Started with Neo4j
cards.body:
Neo4j is a Graph Database consisting of nodes connected together by relationships. You might consider using a Graph
database if you have a highly connected dataset or have queries with many joins.

• [Download Neo4j Desktop](https://neo4j.com/download) _download Neo4j desktop or server editions_
• [Neo4j Sandbox](https://sandbox.neo4j.com) _pick a data set - no installation required_
• [Neo4j Aura](https://neo4j.com/aura) _free Neo4j instance in the cloud_
• [Neo4j GraphAcademy](https://neo4j.com/graphacademy) _free, self-paced, hands-on online training_
• [GraphGists](https://neo4j.com/graphgists) _use ase and industry specific example graphs_

cards.title: Graph Database Concepts
cards.body:
|                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Nodes**             | Nodes are commonly used to represent _entities_ or _things_ in your data. For example, a **Person** or **Movie**                                                                                                                         |
| **Relationships**     | Relationships are used to connect two nodes together and organise the data into structure. For example, a Person **acted in** a movie. A relationship has a _type_ and _direction_, although the direction can be ignored at query time. |
| **Labels**            | Labels are used to group nodes into categories. For example, a person may have `Person` and `Actor` labels.                                                                                                                              |
| **Relationship Type** | Each relationship has a type. Relationships allow you to explore smaller sections of a graph.                                                                                                                                            |
| **Properties**        | Both nodes and relationships can have properties set against them. Properties are [name-value pairs](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/4.3/syntax/values/#cypher-values).                                                             |

cards.title: Read query structure
cards.body:
```
[USE]
[MATCH WHERE]
[OPTIONAL MATCH WHERE]
[WITH [ORDER BY] [SKIP] [LIMIT]]
RETURN [ORDER BY] [SKIP] [LIMIT]
```

cards.title: Write-only query structure
cards.body:
```
[USE]
(CREATE | MERGE)*
[SET|DELETE|REMOVE|FOREACH]*
[RETURN [ORDER BY] [SKIP] [LIMIT]]
```

cards.title: Read-write query structure
cards.body:
```
[USE]
[MATCH WHERE]
[OPTIONAL MATCH WHERE]
[WITH [ORDER BY] [SKIP] [LIMIT]]
(CREATE | MERGE)*
[SET|DELETE|REMOVE|FOREACH]*
[RETURN [ORDER BY] [SKIP] [LIMIT]]
```

cards.title: MATCH
cards.body: %60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(n%3APerson)-%5B%3AKNOWS%5D-%3E(m%3APerson)%0AWHERE%20n.name%20%3D%20'Alice'%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ANode%20patterns%20can%20contain%20labels%20and%20properties.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(n)--%3E(m)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAny%20pattern%20can%20be%20used%20in%20MATCH.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(n%20%7Bname%3A%20'Alice'%7D)--%3E(m)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0APatterns%20with%20node%20properties.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20p%20%3D%20(n)--%3E(m)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAssign%20a%20path%20to%20p.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AOPTIONAL%20MATCH%20(n)-%5Br%5D-%3E(m)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AOptional%20pattern%3A%20nulls%20will%20be%20used%20for%20missing%20parts.

cards.title: WHERE
cards.body:
```
WHERE n.property <> $value
```

Use a predicate to filter. Note that WHERE is always part of a MATCH, OPTIONAL MATCH or WITH clause. Putting it after a
different clause in a query will alter what it does.

```
WHERE EXISTS {
  MATCH (n)-->(m) WHERE n.age = m.age
}
```

Use an existential subquery to filter.

cards.title: RETURN
cards.body:
```
RETURN *
```

Return the value of all variables.

```
RETURN n AS columnName
```

Use alias for result column name.

```
RETURN DISTINCT n
```

Return unique rows.

```
ORDER BY n.property
```

Sort the result.

```
ORDER BY n.property DESC
```

Sort the result in descending order.

```
SKIP $skipNumber
```

Skip a number of results.

```
LIMIT $limitNumber
```

Limit the number of results.

```
SKIP $skipNumber LIMIT $limitNumber
```

Skip results at the top and limit the number of results.

```
RETURN count(*)
```

The number of matching rows. See Aggregating functions for more.

cards.title: WITH
cards.body:
```
MATCH (user)-[:FRIEND]-(friend)
WHERE user.name = $name
WITH user, count(friend) AS friends
WHERE friends > 10
RETURN user
```

The WITH syntax is similar to RETURN. It separates query parts explicitly, allowing you to declare which variables to
carry over to the next part.

```
MATCH (user)-[:FRIEND]-(friend)
WITH user, count(friend) AS friends
ORDER BY friends DESC
  SKIP 1
  LIMIT 3
RETURN user
```

ORDER BY, SKIP, and LIMIT can also be used with WITH.

cards.title: UNION
cards.body:
```
MATCH (a)-[:KNOWS]->(b)
RETURN b.name
UNION
MATCH (a)-[:LOVES]->(b)
RETURN b.name
```

Returns the distinct union of all query results. Result column types and names have to match.

```
MATCH (a)-[:KNOWS]->(b)
RETURN b.name
UNION ALL
MATCH (a)-[:LOVES]->(b)
RETURN b.name
```

Returns the union of all query results, including duplicated rows.

cards.title: CREATE
cards.body:
```
CREATE (n {name: $value})
```

Create a node with the given properties.

```
CREATE (n $map)
```

Create a node with the given properties.

```
UNWIND $listOfMaps AS properties
CREATE (n) SET n = properties
```

Create nodes with the given properties.

```
CREATE (n)-[r:KNOWS]->(m)
```

Create a relationship with the given type and direction; bind a variable to it.

```
CREATE (n)-[:LOVES {since: $value}]->(m)
```

Create a relationship with the given type, direction, and properties.

cards.title: SET
cards.body:
```
SET n.property1 = $value1,
    n.property2 = $value2
```

Update or create a property.

```
SET n = $map
```

Set all properties. This will remove any existing properties.

```
SET n += $map
```

Add and update properties, while keeping existing ones.

```
SET n:Person
```

Adds a label Person to a node.

cards.title: MERGE
cards.body:
```
MERGE (n:Person {name: $value})
  ON CREATE SET n.created = timestamp()
  ON MATCH SET
    n.counter = coalesce(n.counter, 0) + 1,
    n.accessTime = timestamp()
```

Match a pattern or create it if it does not exist. Use ON CREATE and ON MATCH for conditional updates.

```
MATCH (a:Person {name: $value1}),
      (b:Person {name: $value2})
MERGE (a)-[r:LOVES]->(b)
```

MERGE finds or creates a relationship between the nodes.

```
MATCH (a:Person {name: $value1})
MERGE
  (a)-[r:KNOWS]->(b:Person {name: $value3})
```

MERGE finds or creates paths attached to the node.

cards.title: DELETE
cards.body:
```
DELETE n, r
```

Delete a node and a relationship.

```
DETACH DELETE n
```

Delete a node and all relationships connected to it.

```
MATCH (n)
DETACH DELETE n
```

Delete all nodes and relationships from the database.

cards.title: REMOVE
cards.body:
```
REMOVE n:Person
```

Remove a label from n.

```
REMOVE n.property
```

Remove a property.

cards.title: FOREACH
cards.body:
```
FOREACH (r IN relationships(path) |
  SET r.marked = true)
```

Execute a mutating operation for each relationship in a path.

```
FOREACH (value IN coll |
 CREATE (:Person {name: value}))
```

Execute a mutating operation for each element in a list.

cards.title: CALL subquery
cards.body:
```
CALL {
  MATCH (p:Person)-[:FRIEND_OF]->(other:Person) RETURN p, other
  UNION
  MATCH (p:Child)-[:CHILD_OF]->(other:Parent) RETURN p, other
}
```

This calls a subquery with two union parts. The result of the subquery can afterwards be post-processed.

cards.title: CALL%20procedure
cards.body: %60%60%60%0ACALL%20db.labels()%20YIELD%20label%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AThis%20shows%20a%20standalone%20call%20to%20the%20built-in%20procedure%20db.labels%20to%20list%20all%20labels%20used%20in%20the%20database.%20Note%20that%0Arequired%20procedure%20arguments%20are%20given%20explicitly%20in%20brackets%20after%20the%20procedure%20name.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACALL%20db.labels()%20YIELD%20*%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AStandalone%20calls%20may%20use%20YIELD%20%5C*%20to%20return%20all%20columns.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACALL%20java.stored.procedureWithArgs%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AStandalone%20calls%20may%20omit%20YIELD%20and%20also%20provide%20arguments%20implicitly%20via%20statement%20parameters%2C%20e.g.%20a%20standalone%20call%0Arequiring%20one%20argument%20input%20may%20be%20run%20by%20passing%20the%20parameter%20map%20%7Binput%3A%20'foo'%7D.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACALL%20db.labels()%20YIELD%20label%0ARETURN%20count(label)%20AS%20count%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACalls%20the%20built-in%20procedure%20db.labels%20inside%20a%20larger%20query%20to%20count%20all%20labels%20used%20in%20the%20database.%20Calls%20inside%20a%0Alarger%20query%20always%20requires%20passing%20arguments%20and%20naming%20results%20explicitly%20with%20YIELD.

cards.title: Import
cards.body: %60%60%60%0ALOAD%20CSV%20FROM%0A'https%3A%2F%2Fneo4j.com%2Fdocs%2Fcypher-refcard%2F4.3%2Fcsv%2Fartists.csv'%20AS%20line%0ACREATE%20(%3AArtist%20%7Bname%3A%20line%5B1%5D%2C%20year%3A%20toInteger(line%5B2%5D)%7D)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ALoad%20data%20from%20a%20CSV%20file%20and%20create%20nodes.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ALOAD%20CSV%20WITH%20HEADERS%20FROM%0A'https%3A%2F%2Fneo4j.com%2Fdocs%2Fcypher-refcard%2F4.3%2Fcsv%2Fartists-with-headers.csv'%20AS%20line%0ACREATE%20(%3AArtist%20%7Bname%3A%20line.Name%2C%20year%3A%20toInteger(line.Year)%7D)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ALoad%20CSV%20data%20which%20has%20headers.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AUSING%20PERIODIC%20COMMIT%20500%0ALOAD%20CSV%20WITH%20HEADERS%20FROM%0A'https%3A%2F%2Fneo4j.com%2Fdocs%2Fcypher-refcard%2F4.3%2Fcsv%2Fartists-with-headers.csv'%20AS%20line%0ACREATE%20(%3AArtist%20%7Bname%3A%20line.Name%2C%20year%3A%20toInteger(line.Year)%7D)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACommit%20the%20current%20transaction%20after%20every%20500%20rows%20when%20importing%20large%20amounts%20of%20data.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ALOAD%20CSV%20FROM%0A'https%3A%2F%2Fneo4j.com%2Fdocs%2Fcypher-refcard%2F4.3%2Fcsv%2Fartists-fieldterminator.csv'%0AAS%20line%20FIELDTERMINATOR%20'%3B'%0ACREATE%20(%3AArtist%20%7Bname%3A%20line%5B1%5D%2C%20year%3A%20toInteger(line%5B2%5D)%7D)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20a%20different%20field%20terminator%2C%20not%20the%20default%20which%20is%20a%20comma%20(with%20no%20whitespace%20around%20it).%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ALOAD%20CSV%20FROM%0A'https%3A%2F%2Fneo4j.com%2Fdocs%2Fcypher-refcard%2F4.3%2Fcsv%2Fartists.csv'%20AS%20line%0ARETURN%20DISTINCT%20file()%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20the%20absolute%20path%20of%20the%20file%20that%20LOAD%20CSV%20is%20processing%2C%20returns%20null%20if%20called%20outside%20of%20LOAD%20CSV%20context.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ALOAD%20CSV%20FROM%0A'https%3A%2F%2Fneo4j.com%2Fdocs%2Fcypher-refcard%2F4.3%2Fcsv%2Fartists.csv'%20AS%20line%0ARETURN%20linenumber()%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20the%20line%20number%20that%20LOAD%20CSV%20is%20currently%20processing%2C%20returns%20null%20if%20called%20outside%20of%20LOAD%20CSV%20context.

cards.title: Operators
cards.body:
|                        |                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------- |
| **General**            | DISTINCT, ., []                           |
| **Mathematical**       | +, -, \*, /, %, ^                         |
| **Comparison**         | =, <>, , =, IS NULL, IS NOT NULL |
| **Boolean**            | AND, OR, XOR, NOT                         |
| **String**             | +                                         |
| **List**               | +, IN, [x], [x .. y]                      |
| **Regular Expression** | =~                                        |
| **String matching**    | STARTS WITH, ENDS WITH, CONTAINS          |

cards.title: null
cards.body:
• `null` is used to represent missing/undefined values.

• `null` is not equal to `null`. Not knowing two values does not imply that they are the same value. So the expression

`null = null` yields `null` and not `true`. To check if an expression is `null`, use `IS NULL`.

• Arithmetic expressions, comparisons and function calls (except `coalesce`) will return `null` if any argument is

`null`.

• An attempt to access a missing element in a list or a property that doesn’t exist yields `null`.
• In `OPTIONAL MATCH` clauses, `nulls` will be used for missing parts of the pattern.

cards.title: Patterns
cards.body:
```
(n:Person)
```

Node with Person label.

```
(n:Person:Swedish)
```

Node with both Person and Swedish labels.

```
(n:Person {name: $value})
```

Node with the declared properties.

```
()-[r {name: $value}]-()
```

Matches relationships with the declared properties.

```
(n)-->(m)
```

Relationship from n to m.

```
(n)--(m)
```

Relationship in any direction between n and m.

```
(n:Person)-->(m)
```

Node n labeled Person with relationship to m.

```
(m)<-[:KNOWS]-(n)
```

Relationship of type KNOWS from n to m.

```
(n)-[:KNOWS|:LOVES]->(m)
```

Relationship of type KNOWS or of type LOVES from n to m.

```
(n)-[r]->(m)
```

Bind the relationship to variable r.

```
(n)-[*1..5]->(m)
```

Variable length path of between 1 and 5 relationships from n to m.

```
(n)-[*]->(m)
```

Variable length path of any number of relationships from n to m. (See Performance section.)

```
(n)-[:KNOWS]->(m {property: $value})
```

A relationship of type KNOWS from a node n to a node m with the declared property.

```
shortestPath((n1:Person)-[*..6]-(n2:Person))
```

Find a single shortest path.

```
allShortestPaths((n1:Person)-[*..6]->(n2:Person))
```

Find all shortest paths.

```
size((n)-->()-->())
```

Count the paths matching the pattern.

cards.title: USE
cards.body: %60%60%60%0AUSE%20myDatabase%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ASelect%20myDatabase%20to%20execute%20query%2C%20or%20query%20part%2C%20against.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AUSE%20neo4j%0AMATCH%20(n%3APerson)-%5B%3AKNOWS%5D-%3E(m%3APerson)%0AWHERE%20n.name%20%3D%20'Alice'%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AMATCH%20query%20executed%20against%20neo4j%20database.

cards.title: SHOW FUNCTIONS and PROCEDURES
cards.body:
```
SHOW FUNCTIONS
```

Listing all available functions.

```
SHOW PROCEDURES EXECUTABLE YIELD name
```

List all procedures that can be executed by the current user and return only the name of the procedures.

cards.title: Labels
cards.body:
```
CREATE (n:Person {name: $value})
```

Create a node with label and property.

```
MERGE (n:Person {name: $value})
```

Matches or creates unique node(s) with the label and property.

```
SET n:Spouse:Parent:Employee
```

Add label(s) to a node.

```
MATCH (n:Person)
```

Matches nodes labeled Person.

```
MATCH (n:Person)
WHERE n.name = $value
```

Matches nodes labeled Person with the given name.

```
WHERE (n:Person)
```

Checks the existence of the label on the node.

```
labels(n)
```

Labels of the node.

```
REMOVE n:Person
```

Remove the label from the node.

cards.title: Lists
cards.body: %60%60%60%0A%5B'a'%2C%20'b'%2C%20'c'%5D%20AS%20list%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ALiteral%20lists%20are%20declared%20in%20square%20brackets.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Asize(%24list)%20AS%20len%2C%20%24list%5B0%5D%20AS%20value%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ALists%20can%20be%20passed%20in%20as%20parameters.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Arange(%24firstNum%2C%20%24lastNum%2C%20%24step)%20AS%20list%0A%60%60%60%0A%0Arange()%20creates%20a%20list%20of%20numbers%20(step%20is%20optional)%2C%20other%20functions%20returning%20lists%20are%3A%20labels()%2C%20nodes()%2C%0Arelationships().%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20p%20%3D%20(a)-%5B%3AKNOWS*%5D-%3E()%0ARETURN%20relationships(p)%20AS%20r%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AThe%20list%20of%20relationships%20comprising%20a%20variable%20length%20path%20can%20be%20returned%20using%20named%20paths%20and%20relationships().%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ARETURN%20matchedNode.list%5B0%5D%20AS%20value%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20size(matchedNode.list)%20AS%20len%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AProperties%20can%20be%20lists%20of%20strings%2C%20numbers%20or%20booleans.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Alist%5B%24idx%5D%20AS%20value%2C%0Alist%5B%24startIdx..%24endIdx%5D%20AS%20slice%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20elements%20can%20be%20accessed%20with%20idx%20subscripts%20in%20square%20brackets.%20Invalid%20indexes%20return%20null.%20Slices%20can%20be%0Aretrieved%20with%20intervals%20from%20start_idx%20to%20end_idx%2C%20each%20of%20which%20can%20be%20omitted%20or%20negative.%20Out%20of%20range%20elements%20are%0Aignored.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AUNWIND%20%24names%20AS%20name%0AMATCH%20(n%20%7Bname%3A%20name%7D)%0ARETURN%20avg(n.age)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AWith%20UNWIND%2C%20any%20list%20can%20be%20transformed%20back%20into%20individual%20rows.%20The%20example%20matches%20all%20names%20from%20a%20list%20of%20names.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(a)%0ARETURN%20%5B(a)--%3E(b)%20WHERE%20b.name%20%3D%20'Bob'%20%7C%20b.age%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0APattern%20comprehensions%20may%20be%20used%20to%20do%20a%20custom%20projection%20from%20a%20match%20directly%20into%20a%20list.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(person)%0ARETURN%20person%20%7B%20.name%2C%20.age%7D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AMap%20projections%20may%20be%20easily%20constructed%20from%20nodes%2C%20relationships%20and%20other%20map%20values.

cards.title: Maps
cards.body: %60%60%60%0A%7Bname%3A%20'Alice'%2C%20age%3A%2038%2C%0A%20address%3A%20%7Bcity%3A%20'London'%2C%20residential%3A%20true%7D%7D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ALiteral%20maps%20are%20declared%20in%20curly%20braces%20much%20like%20property%20maps.%20Lists%20are%20supported.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AWITH%20%7Bperson%3A%20%7Bname%3A%20'Anne'%2C%20age%3A%2025%7D%7D%20AS%20p%0ARETURN%20p.person.name%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAccess%20the%20property%20of%20a%20nested%20map.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMERGE%20(p%3APerson%20%7Bname%3A%20%24map.name%7D)%0A%20%20ON%20CREATE%20SET%20p%20%3D%20%24map%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AMaps%20can%20be%20passed%20in%20as%20parameters%20and%20used%20either%20as%20a%20map%20or%20by%20accessing%20keys.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(matchedNode%3APerson)%0ARETURN%20matchedNode%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ANodes%20and%20relationships%20are%20returned%20as%20maps%20of%20their%20data.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Amap.name%2C%20map.age%2C%20map.children%5B0%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AMap%20entries%20can%20be%20accessed%20by%20their%20keys.%20Invalid%20keys%20result%20in%20an%20error.

cards.title: Predicates
cards.body: %60%60%60%0An.property%20%3C%3E%20%24value%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20comparison%20operators.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AtoString(n.property)%20%3D%20%24value%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20functions.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0An.number%20%3E%3D%201%20AND%20n.number%20%3C%3D%2010%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20boolean%20operators%20to%20combine%20predicates.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0A1%20%3C%3D%20n.number%20%3C%3D%2010%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AUse%20chained%20operators%20to%20combine%20predicates.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0An%3APerson%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACheck%20for%20node%20labels.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Avariable%20IS%20NOT%20NULL%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACheck%20if%20something%20is%20not%20null%2C%20e.g.%20that%20a%20property%20exists.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0An.property%20IS%20NULL%20OR%20n.property%20%3D%20%24value%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AEither%20the%20property%20does%20not%20exist%20or%20the%20predicate%20is%20true.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0An.property%20%3D%20%24value%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ANon-existing%20property%20returns%20null%2C%20which%20is%20not%20equal%20to%20anything.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0An%5B%22property%22%5D%20%3D%20%24value%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AProperties%20may%20also%20be%20accessed%20using%20a%20dynamically%20computed%20property%20name.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0An.property%20STARTS%20WITH%20'Tim'%20OR%0An.property%20ENDS%20WITH%20'n'%20OR%0An.property%20CONTAINS%20'goodie'%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AString%20matching.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0An.property%20%3D~%20'Tim.*'%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AString%20regular%20expression%20matching.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0A(n)-%5B%3AKNOWS%5D-%3E(m)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AEnsure%20the%20pattern%20has%20at%20least%20one%20match.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ANOT%20(n)-%5B%3AKNOWS%5D-%3E(m)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AExclude%20matches%20to%20(n)-%5B%3AKNOWS%5D-%3E(m)%20from%20the%20result.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0An.property%20IN%20%5B%24value1%2C%20%24value2%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACheck%20if%20an%20element%20exists%20in%20a%20list.

cards.title: List predicates
cards.body:
```
all(x IN coll WHERE x.property IS NOT NULL)
```

Returns true if the predicate is true for all elements in the list.

```
any(x IN coll WHERE x.property IS NOT NULL)
```

Returns true if the predicate is true for at least one element in the list.

```
none(x IN coll WHERE x.property IS NOT NULL)
```

Returns true if the predicate is false for all elements in the list.

```
single(x IN coll WHERE x.property IS NOT NULL)
```

Returns true if the predicate is true for exactly one element in the list.

cards.title: CASE
cards.body: %60%60%60%0ACASE%20n.eyes%0A%20WHEN%20'blue'%20THEN%201%0A%20WHEN%20'brown'%20THEN%202%0A%20ELSE%203%0AEND%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturn%20THEN%20value%20from%20the%20matching%20WHEN%20value.%20The%20ELSE%20value%20is%20optional%2C%20and%20substituted%20for%20null%20if%20missing.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACASE%0A%20WHEN%20n.eyes%20%3D%20'blue'%20THEN%201%0A%20WHEN%20n.age%20%3C%2040%20THEN%202%0A%20ELSE%203%0AEND%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturn%20THEN%20value%20from%20the%20first%20WHEN%20predicate%20evaluating%20to%20true.%20Predicates%20are%20evaluated%20in%20order.

cards.title: List%20expressions
cards.body: %60%60%60%0Asize(%24list)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ANumber%20of%20elements%20in%20the%20list.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Areverse(%24list)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReverse%20the%20order%20of%20the%20elements%20in%20the%20list.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Ahead(%24list)%2C%20last(%24list)%2C%20tail(%24list)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0Ahead()%20returns%20the%20first%2C%20last()%20the%20last%20element%20of%20the%20list.%20tail()%20returns%20all%20but%20the%20first%20element.%20All%20return%20null%0Afor%20an%20empty%20list.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0A%5Bx%20IN%20list%20%7C%20x.prop%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AA%20list%20of%20the%20value%20of%20the%20expression%20for%20each%20element%20in%20the%20original%20list.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0A%5Bx%20IN%20list%20WHERE%20x.prop%20%3C%3E%20%24value%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AA%20filtered%20list%20of%20the%20elements%20where%20the%20predicate%20is%20true.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0A%5Bx%20IN%20list%20WHERE%20x.prop%20%3C%3E%20%24value%20%7C%20x.prop%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AA%20list%20comprehension%20that%20filters%20a%20list%20and%20extracts%20the%20value%20of%20the%20expression%20for%20each%20element%20in%20that%20list.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Areduce(s%20%3D%20%22%22%2C%20x%20IN%20list%20%7C%20s%20%2B%20x.prop)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AEvaluate%20expression%20for%20each%20element%20in%20the%20list%2C%20accumulate%20the%20results.

cards.title: Functions
cards.body:
```
coalesce(n.property, $defaultValue)
```

The first non-null expression.

```
timestamp()
```

Milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.

```
id(nodeOrRelationship)
```

The internal id of the relationship or node.

```
toInteger($expr)
```

Converts the given input into an integer if possible; otherwise it returns null.

```
toFloat($expr)
```

Converts the given input into a floating point number if possible; otherwise it returns null.

```
toBoolean($expr)
```

Converts the given input into a boolean if possible; otherwise it returns null.

```
keys($expr)
```

Returns a list of string representations for the property names of a node, relationship, or map.

```
properties($expr)
```

Returns a map containing all the properties of a node or relationship.

cards.title: Path functions
cards.body:
```
length(path)
```

The number of relationships in the path.

```
nodes(path)
```

The nodes in the path as a list.

```
relationships(path)
```

The relationships in the path as a list.

```
[x IN nodes(path) | x.prop]
```

Extract properties from the nodes in a path.

cards.title: Spatial functions
cards.body:
```
point({x: $x, y: $y})
```

Returns a point in a 2D cartesian coordinate system.

```
point({latitude: $y, longitude: $x})
```

Returns a point in a 2D geographic coordinate system, with coordinates specified in decimal degrees.

```
point({x: $x, y: $y, z: $z})
```

Returns a point in a 3D cartesian coordinate system.

```
point({latitude: $y, longitude: $x, height: $z})
```

Returns a point in a 3D geographic coordinate system, with latitude and longitude in decimal degrees, and height in
meters.

```
distance(point({x: $x1, y: $y1}), point({x: $x2, y: $y2}))
```

Returns a floating point number representing the linear distance between two points. The returned units will be the same
as those of the point coordinates, and it will work for both 2D and 3D cartesian points.

```
distance(point({latitude: $y1, longitude: $x1}), point({latitude: $y2, longitude: $x2}))
```

Returns the geodesic distance between two points in meters. It can be used for 3D geographic points as well.

cards.title: Temporal%20functions
cards.body: %60%60%60%0Adate(%222018-04-05%22)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20date%20parsed%20from%20a%20string.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Alocaltime(%2212%3A45%3A30.25%22)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20time%20with%20no%20time%20zone.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Atime(%2212%3A45%3A30.25%2B01%3A00%22)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20time%20in%20a%20specified%20time%20zone.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Alocaldatetime(%222018-04-05T12%3A34%3A00%22)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20datetime%20with%20no%20time%20zone.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Adatetime(%222018-04-05T12%3A34%3A00%5BEurope%2FBerlin%5D%22)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20datetime%20in%20the%20specified%20time%20zone.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Adatetime(%7BepochMillis%3A%203360000%7D)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ATransforms%203360000%20as%20a%20UNIX%20Epoch%20time%20into%20a%20normal%20datetime.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Adate(%7Byear%3A%20%24year%2C%20month%3A%20%24month%2C%20day%3A%20%24day%7D)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAll%20of%20the%20temporal%20functions%20can%20also%20be%20called%20with%20a%20map%20of%20named%20components.%20This%20example%20returns%20a%20date%20from%20year%2C%0Amonth%20and%20day%20components.%20Each%20function%20supports%20a%20different%20set%20of%20possible%20components.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Adatetime(%7Bdate%3A%20%24date%2C%20time%3A%20%24time%7D)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ATemporal%20types%20can%20be%20created%20by%20combining%20other%20types.%20This%20example%20creates%20a%20datetime%20from%20a%20date%20and%20a%20time.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Adate(%7Bdate%3A%20%24datetime%2C%20day%3A%205%7D)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ATemporal%20types%20can%20be%20created%20by%20selecting%20from%20more%20complex%20types%2C%20as%20well%20as%20overriding%20individual%20components.%20This%0Aexample%20creates%20a%20date%20by%20selecting%20from%20a%20datetime%2C%20as%20well%20as%20overriding%20the%20day%20component.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AWITH%20date(%222018-04-05%22)%20AS%20d%0ARETURN%20d.year%2C%20d.month%2C%20d.day%2C%20d.week%2C%20d.dayOfWeek%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAccessors%20allow%20extracting%20components%20of%20temporal%20types.

cards.title: Duration%20functions
cards.body: %60%60%60%0Aduration(%22P1Y2M10DT12H45M30.25S%22)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20duration%20of%201%20year%2C%202%20months%2C%2010%20days%2C%2012%20hours%2C%2045%20minutes%20and%2030.25%20seconds.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Aduration.between(%24date1%2C%24date2)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20duration%20between%20two%20temporal%20instances.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AWITH%20duration(%22P1Y2M10DT12H45M%22)%20AS%20d%0ARETURN%20d.years%2C%20d.months%2C%20d.days%2C%20d.hours%2C%20d.minutes%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%201%20year%2C%2014%20months%2C%2010%20days%2C%2012%20hours%20and%20765%20minutes.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AWITH%20duration(%22P1Y2M10DT12H45M%22)%20AS%20d%0ARETURN%20d.years%2C%20d.monthsOfYear%2C%20d.days%2C%20d.hours%2C%20d.minutesOfHour%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%201%20year%2C%202%20months%2C%2010%20days%2C%2012%20hours%20and%2045%20minutes.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Adate(%222015-01-01%22)%20%2B%20duration(%22P1Y1M1D%22)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20date%20of%202016-02-02.%20It%20is%20also%20possible%20to%20subtract%20durations%20from%20temporal%20instances.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0Aduration(%22PT30S%22)%20*%2010%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AReturns%20a%20duration%20of%205%20minutes.%20It%20is%20also%20possible%20to%20divide%20a%20duration%20by%20a%20number.

cards.title: Mathematical functions
cards.body:
```
abs($expr)
```

The absolute value.

```
rand()
```

Returns a random number in the range from 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive), [0,1). Returns a new value for each call. Also
useful for selecting a subset or random ordering.

```
round($expr)
```

Round to the nearest integer; ceil() and floor() find the next integer up or down.

```
sqrt($expr)
```

The square root.

```
sign($expr)
```

0 if zero, -1 if negative, 1 if positive.

```
sin($expr)
```

Trigonometric functions also include cos(), tan(), cot(), asin(), acos(), atan(), atan2(), and haversin(). All arguments
for the trigonometric functions should be in radians, if not otherwise specified.

```
degrees($expr), radians($expr), pi()
```

Converts radians into degrees; use radians() for the reverse, and pi() for π.

```
log10($expr), log($expr), exp($expr), e()
```

Logarithm base 10, natural logarithm, e to the power of the parameter, and the value of e.

cards.title: String functions
cards.body:
```
toString($expression)
```

String representation of the expression.

```
replace($original, $search, $replacement)
```

Replace all occurrences of search with replacement. All arguments must be expressions.

```
substring($original, $begin, $subLength)
```

Get part of a string. The subLength argument is optional.

```
left($original, $subLength),
  right($original, $subLength)
```

The first part of a string. The last part of the string.

```
trim($original), lTrim($original),
  rTrim($original)
```

Trim all whitespace, or on the left or right side.

```
toUpper($original), toLower($original)
```

UPPERCASE and lowercase.

```
split($original, $delimiter)
```

Split a string into a list of strings.

```
reverse($original)
```

Reverse a string.

```
size($string)
```

Calculate the number of characters in the string.

cards.title: Relationship functions
cards.body:
```
type(a_relationship)
```

String representation of the relationship type.

```
startNode(a_relationship)
```

Start node of the relationship.

```
endNode(a_relationship)
```

End node of the relationship.

```
id(a_relationship)
```

The internal id of the relationship.

cards.title: Aggregating functions
cards.body:
```
count(*)
```

The number of matching rows.

```
count(variable)
```

The number of non-null values.

```
count(DISTINCT variable)
```

All aggregating functions also take the DISTINCT operator, which removes duplicates from the values.

```
collect(n.property)
```

List from the values, ignores null.

```
sum(n.property)
```

Sum numerical values. Similar functions are avg(), min(), max().

```
percentileDisc(n.property, $percentile)
```

Discrete percentile. Continuous percentile is percentileCont(). The percentile argument is from 0.0 to 1.0.

```
stDev(n.property)
```

Standard deviation for a sample of a population. For an entire population use stDevP().

cards.title: INDEX
cards.body: %60%60%60%0ACREATE%20INDEX%20FOR%20(p%3APerson)%20ON%20(p.name)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20an%20index%20on%20nodes%20with%20label%20Person%20and%20property%20name.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20INDEX%20index_name%20FOR%20()-%5Bk%3AKNOWS%5D-()%20ON%20(k.since)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20an%20index%20on%20relationships%20with%20type%20KNOWS%20and%20property%20since%20with%20the%20name%20index_name.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20INDEX%20FOR%20(p%3APerson)%20ON%20(p.surname)%0AOPTIONS%20%7BindexProvider%3A%20'native-btree-1.0'%2C%20indexConfig%3A%20%7B%60spatial.cartesian.min%60%3A%20%5B-100.0%2C%20-100.0%5D%2C%20%60spatial.cartesian.max%60%3A%20%5B100.0%2C%20100.0%5D%7D%7D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20an%20index%20on%20nodes%20with%20label%20Person%20and%20property%20surname%20with%20the%20index%20provider%20native-btree-1.0%20and%20given%0Aspatial.cartesian%20settings.%20The%20other%20index%20settings%20will%20have%20their%20default%20values.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20INDEX%20FOR%20(p%3APerson)%20ON%20(p.name%2C%20p.age)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20composite%20index%20on%20nodes%20with%20label%20Person%20and%20the%20properties%20name%20and%20age%2C%20throws%20an%20error%20if%20the%20index%0Aalready%20exist.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20INDEX%20IF%20NOT%20EXISTS%20FOR%20(p%3APerson)%20ON%20(p.name%2C%20p.age)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20composite%20index%20on%20nodes%20with%20label%20Person%20and%20the%20properties%20name%20and%20age%20if%20it%20does%20not%20already%20exist%2C%20does%0Anothing%20if%20it%20did%20exist.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20LOOKUP%20INDEX%20lookup_index_name%20FOR%20(n)%20ON%20EACH%20labels(n)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20token%20lookup%20index%20with%20the%20name%20lookup_index_name%20on%20nodes%20with%20any%20label%20.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20LOOKUP%20INDEX%20FOR%20()-%5Br%5D-()%20ON%20EACH%20type(r)%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20token%20lookup%20index%20on%20relationships%20with%20any%20relationship%20type.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20FULLTEXT%20INDEX%20node_fulltext_index_name%20FOR%20(n%3AFriend)%20ON%20EACH%20%5Bn.name%5D%0AOPTIONS%20%7BindexConfig%3A%20%7B%60fulltext.analyzer%60%3A%20'swedish'%7D%7D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20fulltext%20index%20on%20nodes%20with%20the%20name%20node_fulltext_index_name%20and%20analyzer%20swedish.%20Fulltext%20indexes%20on%20nodes%0Acan%20only%20be%20used%20by%20from%20the%20procedure%20db.index.fulltext.queryNodes.%20The%20other%20index%20settings%20will%20have%20their%20default%0Avalues.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20FULLTEXT%20INDEX%20rel_fulltext_index_name%20FOR%20()-%5Br%3AHAS_PET%7CBROUGHT_PET%5D-()%20ON%20EACH%20%5Br.since%2C%20r.price%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20fulltext%20index%20on%20relationships%20with%20the%20name%20rel_fulltext_index_name.%20Fulltext%20indexes%20on%20relationships%20can%0Aonly%20be%20used%20by%20from%20the%20procedure%20db.index.fulltext.queryRelationships.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20INDEXES%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20indexes.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(n%3APerson)%20WHERE%20n.name%20%3D%20%24value%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAn%20index%20can%20be%20automatically%20used%20for%20the%20equality%20comparison.%20Note%20that%20for%20example%20toLower(n.name)%20%3D%20%24value%20will%20not%0Ause%20an%20index.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(n%3APerson)%0AWHERE%20n.name%20IN%20%5B%24value%5D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAn%20index%20can%20automatically%20be%20used%20for%20the%20IN%20list%20checks.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(n%3APerson)%0AWHERE%20n.name%20%3D%20%24value%20and%20n.age%20%3D%20%24value2%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AA%20composite%20index%20can%20be%20automatically%20used%20for%20equality%20comparison%20of%20both%20properties.%20Note%20that%20there%20needs%20to%20be%0Apredicates%20on%20all%20properties%20of%20the%20composite%20index%20for%20it%20to%20be%20used.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AMATCH%20(n%3APerson)%0AUSING%20INDEX%20n%3APerson(name)%0AWHERE%20n.name%20%3D%20%24value%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AIndex%20usage%20can%20be%20enforced%20when%20Cypher%20uses%20a%20suboptimal%20index%2C%20or%20more%20than%20one%20index%20should%20be%20used.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ADROP%20INDEX%20index_name%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADrop%20the%20index%20named%20index_name%2C%20throws%20an%20error%20if%20the%20index%20does%20not%20exist.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ADROP%20INDEX%20index_name%20IF%20EXISTS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADrop%20the%20index%20named%20index_name%20if%20it%20exists%2C%20does%20nothing%20if%20it%20does%20not%20exist.

cards.title: CONSTRAINT
cards.body: %60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20ON%20(p%3APerson)%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20p.name%20IS%20UNIQUE%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20unique%20property%20constraint%20on%20the%20label%20Person%20and%20property%20name.%20If%20any%20other%20node%20with%20that%20label%20is%20updated%0Aor%20created%20with%20a%20name%20that%20already%20exists%2C%20the%20write%20operation%20will%20fail.%20This%20constraint%20will%20create%20an%20accompanying%0Aindex.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20uniqueness%20ON%20(p%3APerson)%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20p.age%20IS%20UNIQUE%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20unique%20property%20constraint%20on%20the%20label%20Person%20and%20property%20age%20with%20the%20name%20uniqueness.%20If%20any%20other%20node%0Awith%20that%20label%20is%20updated%20or%20created%20with%20a%20age%20that%20already%20exists%2C%20the%20write%20operation%20will%20fail.%20This%20constraint%0Awill%20create%20an%20accompanying%20index.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20ON%20(p%3APerson)%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20p.surname%20IS%20UNIQUE%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20OPTIONS%20%7BindexProvider%3A%20'native-btree-1.0'%7D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20unique%20property%20constraint%20on%20the%20label%20Person%20and%20property%20surname%20with%20the%20index%20provider%20native-btree-1.0%0Afor%20the%20accompanying%20index.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20ON%20(p%3APerson)%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20p.name%20IS%20NOT%20NULL%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Create%20a%20node%20property%20existence%20constraint%20on%20the%20label%20Person%20and%20property%20name%2C%20throws%20an%20error%20if%20the%20constraint%0Aalready%20exists.%20If%20a%20node%20with%20that%20label%20is%20created%20without%20a%20name%2C%20or%20if%20the%20name%20property%20is%20removed%20from%20an%20existing%0Anode%20with%20the%20Person%20label%2C%20the%20write%20operation%20will%20fail.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20node_exists%20IF%20NOT%20EXISTS%20ON%20(p%3APerson)%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20p.name%20IS%20NOT%20NULL%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20If%20a%20node%20property%20existence%20constraint%20on%20the%20label%20Person%20and%20property%20name%20or%20any%20constraint%20with%20the%20name%0Anode_exists%20already%20exist%20then%20nothing%20happens.%20If%20no%20such%20constraint%20exists%2C%20then%20it%20will%20be%20created.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20ON%20()-%5Bl%3ALIKED%5D-()%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20l.when%20IS%20NOT%20NULL%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Create%20a%20relationship%20property%20existence%20constraint%20on%20the%20type%20LIKED%20and%20property%20when.%20If%20a%20relationship%20with%20that%0Atype%20is%20created%20without%20a%20when%2C%20or%20if%20the%20when%20property%20is%20removed%20from%20an%20existing%20relationship%20with%20the%20LIKED%20type%2C%0Athe%20write%20operation%20will%20fail.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20relationship_exists%20ON%20()-%5Bl%3ALIKED%5D-()%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20l.since%20IS%20NOT%20NULL%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Create%20a%20relationship%20property%20existence%20constraint%20on%20the%20type%20LIKED%20and%20property%20since%20with%20the%20name%0Arelationship_exists.%20If%20a%20relationship%20with%20that%20type%20is%20created%20without%20a%20since%2C%20or%20if%20the%20since%20property%20is%20removed%0Afrom%20an%20existing%20relationship%20with%20the%20LIKED%20type%2C%20the%20write%20operation%20will%20fail.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20UNIQUE%20CONSTRAINTS%20YIELD%20*%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20unique%20constraints.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20ON%20(p%3APerson)%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20(p.firstname%2C%20p.surname)%20IS%20NODE%20KEY%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Create%20a%20node%20key%20constraint%20on%20the%20label%20Person%20and%20properties%20firstname%20and%20surname.%20If%20a%20node%20with%20that%20label%20is%0Acreated%20without%20both%20firstname%20and%20surname%20or%20if%20the%20combination%20of%20the%20two%20is%20not%20unique%2C%20or%20if%20the%20firstname%20and%2For%0Asurname%20labels%20on%20an%20existing%20node%20with%20the%20Person%20label%20is%20modified%20to%20violate%20these%20constraints%2C%20the%20write%20operation%0Awill%20fail.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20node_key%20ON%20(p%3APerson)%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20(p.name%2C%20p.surname)%20IS%20NODE%20KEY%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Create%20a%20node%20key%20constraint%20on%20the%20label%20Person%20and%20properties%20name%20and%20surname%20with%20the%20name%20node_key.%20If%20a%20node%0Awith%20that%20label%20is%20created%20without%20both%20name%20and%20surname%20or%20if%20the%20combination%20of%20the%20two%20is%20not%20unique%2C%20or%20if%20the%20name%0Aand%2For%20surname%20labels%20on%20an%20existing%20node%20with%20the%20Person%20label%20is%20modified%20to%20violate%20these%20constraints%2C%20the%20write%0Aoperation%20will%20fail.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20CONSTRAINT%20node_key_with_config%20ON%20(p%3APerson)%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20ASSERT%20(p.name%2C%20p.age)%20IS%20NODE%20KEY%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20OPTIONS%20%7BindexConfig%3A%20%7B%60spatial.wgs-84.min%60%3A%20%5B-100.0%2C%20-100.0%5D%2C%20%60spatial.wgs-84.max%60%3A%20%5B100.0%2C%20100.0%5D%7D%7D%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Create%20a%20node%20key%20constraint%20on%20the%20label%20Person%20and%20properties%20name%20and%20age%20with%20the%20name%20node_key_with_config%20and%0Agiven%20spatial.wgs-84%20settings%20for%20the%20accompanying%20index.%20The%20other%20index%20settings%20will%20have%20their%20default%20values.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ADROP%20CONSTRAINT%20uniqueness%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADrop%20the%20constraint%20with%20the%20name%20uniqueness%2C%20throws%20an%20error%20if%20the%20constraint%20does%20not%20exist.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ADROP%20CONSTRAINT%20uniqueness%20IF%20EXISTS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADrop%20the%20constraint%20with%20the%20name%20uniqueness%20if%20it%20exists%2C%20does%20nothing%20if%20it%20does%20not%20exist.

cards.title: Performance
cards.body:
• Use parameters instead of literals when possible. This allows Cypher to re-use your queries instead of having to parse

and build new execution plans.

• Always set an upper limit for your variable length patterns. It’s possible to have a query go wild and touch all nodes

in a graph by mistake.

• Return only the data you need. Avoid returning whole nodes and relationships — instead, pick the data you need and

return only that.

• Use `PROFILE` / `EXPLAIN` to analyze the performance of your queries. See

[Query Tuning](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/4.3/query-tuning) for more information on these and other topics,
such as planner hints.

cards.title: Database%20management
cards.body: %60%60%60%0ACREATE%20OR%20REPLACE%20DATABASE%20myDatabase%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Create%20a%20database%20named%20myDatabase.%20If%20a%20database%20with%20that%20name%20exists%2C%20then%20the%20existing%20database%20is%20deleted%20and%20a%0Anew%20one%20created.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASTOP%20DATABASE%20myDatabase%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Stop%20the%20database%20myDatabase.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASTART%20DATABASE%20myDatabase%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Start%20the%20database%20myDatabase.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20DATABASES%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20databases%20in%20the%20system%20and%20information%20about%20them.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20DATABASES%0AYIELD%20name%2C%20currentStatus%0AWHERE%20name%20CONTAINS%20'my'%20AND%20currentStatus%20%3D%20'online'%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20information%20about%20databases%2C%20filtered%20by%20name%20and%20online%20status%20and%20further%20refined%20by%20conditions%20on%20these.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20DATABASE%20myDatabase%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20information%20about%20the%20database%20myDatabase.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20DEFAULT%20DATABASE%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20information%20about%20the%20default%20database.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20HOME%20DATABASE%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20information%20about%20the%20current%20users%20home%20database.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ADROP%20DATABASE%20myDatabase%20IF%20EXISTS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0A(%E2%98%85)%20Delete%20the%20database%20myDatabase%2C%20if%20it%20exists.

cards.title: User management
cards.body:
```
CREATE USER alice SET PASSWORD $password
```

Create a new user and a password. This password must be changed on the first login.

```
ALTER USER alice SET PASSWORD $password CHANGE NOT REQUIRED
```

Set a new password for a user. This user will not be required to change this password on the next login.

```
ALTER USER alice IF EXISTS SET PASSWORD CHANGE REQUIRED
```

If the specified user exists, force this user to change their password on the next login.

```
ALTER USER alice SET STATUS SUSPENDED
```

(★) Change the user status to suspended. Use SET STATUS ACTIVE to reactivate the user.

```
ALTER USER alice SET HOME DATABASE otherDb
```

(★) Change the home database of user to otherDb. Use REMOVE HOME DATABASE to unset the home database for the user and
fallback to the default database.

```
ALTER CURRENT USER SET PASSWORD FROM $old TO $new
```

Change the password of the logged-in user. The user will not be required to change this password on the next login.

```
SHOW CURRENT USER
```

List the currently logged-in user, their status, roles and whether they need to change their password. (★) Status and
roles are Enterprise Edition only.

```
SHOW USERS
```

List all users in the system, their status, roles and if they need to change their password. (★) Status and roles are
Enterprise Edition only.

```
SHOW USERS
YIELD user, suspended
WHERE suspended = true
```

List users in the system, filtered by their name and status and further refined by whether they are suspended. (★)
Status is Enterprise Edition only.

```
RENAME USER alice TO alice_delete
```

Rename the user alice to alice_delete.

```
DROP USER alice_delete
```

Delete the user.

cards.title: (%E2%98%85)%20Role%20management
cards.body: %60%60%60%0ACREATE%20ROLE%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ACREATE%20ROLE%20my_second_role%20IF%20NOT%20EXISTS%20AS%20COPY%20OF%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ACreate%20a%20role%20named%20my_second_role%2C%20unless%20it%20already%20exists%2C%20as%20a%20copy%20of%20the%20existing%20my_role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ARENAME%20ROLE%20my_second_role%20TO%20my_other_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ARename%20a%20role%20named%20my_second_role%20to%20my_other_role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AGRANT%20ROLE%20my_role%2C%20my_other_role%20TO%20alice%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AAssign%20roles%20to%20a%20user.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AREVOKE%20ROLE%20my_other_role%20FROM%20alice%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ARemove%20a%20specified%20role%20from%20a%20user.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20ROLES%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20roles%20in%20the%20system.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20ROLES%0AYIELD%20role%0AWHERE%20role%20CONTAINS%20'my'%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20roles%2C%20filtered%20by%20the%20name%20of%20the%20role%20and%20further%20refined%20by%20whether%20the%20name%20contains%20'my'.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20POPULATED%20ROLES%20WITH%20USERS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20roles%20that%20are%20assigned%20to%20at%20least%20one%20user%20in%20the%20system%2C%20and%20the%20users%20assigned%20to%20those%20roles.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ADROP%20ROLE%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADelete%20a%20role.

cards.title: (★) Graph read privileges
cards.body:
```
GRANT TRAVERSE ON GRAPH * NODES * TO my_role
```

Grant traverse privilege on all nodes and all graphs to a role.

```
DENY READ {prop} ON GRAPH foo RELATIONSHIP Type TO my_role
```

Deny read privilege on a specified property, on all relationships with a specified type in a specified graph, to a role.

```
GRANT MATCH {*} ON HOME GRAPH ELEMENTS Label TO my_role
```

Grant read privilege on all properties and traverse privilege in the home graph, to a role. Here, both privileges apply
to all nodes and relationships with a specified label/type in the graph.

cards.title: (★) Graph write privileges
cards.body:
```
GRANT CREATE ON GRAPH * NODES Label TO my_role
```

Grant create privilege on all nodes with a specified label in all graphs to a role.

```
DENY DELETE ON GRAPH neo4j TO my_role
```

Deny delete privilege on all nodes and relationships in a specified graph to a role.

```
REVOKE SET LABEL Label ON GRAPH * FROM my_role
```

Revoke set label privilege for the specified label on all graphs to a role.

```
GRANT REMOVE LABEL * ON GRAPH foo TO my_role
```

Grant remove label privilege for all labels on a specified graph to a role.

```
DENY SET PROPERTY {prop} ON GRAPH foo RELATIONSHIPS Type TO my_role
```

Deny set property privilege on a specified property, on all relationships with a specified type in a specified graph, to
a role.

```
GRANT MERGE {*} ON GRAPH * NODES Label TO my_role
```

Grant merge privilege on all properties, on all nodes with a specified label in all graphs, to a role.

```
REVOKE WRITE ON GRAPH * FROM my_role
```

Revoke write privilege on all graphs from a role.

```
DENY ALL GRAPH PRIVILEGES ON GRAPH foo TO my_role
```

Deny all graph privileges privilege on a specified graph to a role.

cards.title: (%E2%98%85)%20SHOW%20PRIVILEGES
cards.body: %60%60%60%0ASHOW%20PRIVILEGES%20AS%20COMMANDS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20privileges%20in%20the%20system%20as%20Cypher%20commands.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20PRIVILEGES%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20privileges%20in%20the%20system%2C%20and%20the%20roles%20that%20they%20are%20assigned%20to.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20PRIVILEGES%0AYIELD%20role%2C%20action%2C%20access%0AWHERE%20role%20%3D%20'my_role'%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20information%20about%20privileges%2C%20filtered%20by%20role%2C%20action%20and%20access%20and%20further%20refined%20by%20the%20name%20of%20the%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20ROLE%20my_role%20PRIVILEGES%20AS%20COMMANDS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20privileges%20assigned%20to%20a%20role%20as%20Cypher%20commands.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20ROLE%20my_role%2C%20my_second_role%20PRIVILEGES%20AS%20COMMANDS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20privileges%20assigned%20to%20each%20of%20the%20multiple%20roles%20as%20Cypher%20commands.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20USER%20alice%20PRIVILEGES%20AS%20COMMANDS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20privileges%20of%20a%20user%2C%20and%20the%20role%20that%20they%20are%20assigned%20to%20as%20Cypher%20commands.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ASHOW%20USER%20PRIVILEGES%20AS%20COMMANDS%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AList%20all%20privileges%20of%20the%20currently%20logged%20in%20user%2C%20and%20the%20role%20that%20they%20are%20assigned%20to%20as%20Cypher%20commands.

cards.title: (★) Database privileges
cards.body:
```
GRANT ACCESS ON DATABASE * TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to access and run queries against all databases to a role.

```
GRANT START ON DATABASE * TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to start all databases to a role.

```
GRANT STOP ON DATABASE * TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to stop all databases to a role.

```
GRANT CREATE INDEX ON DATABASE foo TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to create indexes on a specified database to a role.

```
GRANT DROP INDEX ON DATABASE foo TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to drop indexes on a specified database to a role.

```
GRANT SHOW INDEX ON DATABASE * TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to show indexes on all databases to a role.

```
DENY INDEX MANAGEMENT ON DATABASE bar TO my_role
```

Deny privilege to create and drop indexes on a specified database to a role.

```
GRANT CREATE CONSTRAINT ON DATABASE * TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to create constraints on all databases to a role.

```
DENY DROP CONSTRAINT ON DATABASE * TO my_role
```

Deny privilege to drop constraints on all databases to a role.

```
DENY SHOW CONSTRAINT ON DATABASE foo TO my_role
```

Deny privilege to show constraints on a specified database to a role.

```
REVOKE CONSTRAINT ON DATABASE * FROM my_role
```

Revoke granted and denied privileges to create and drop constraints on all databases from a role.

```
GRANT CREATE NEW LABELS ON DATABASE * TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to create new labels on all databases to a role.

```
DENY CREATE NEW TYPES ON DATABASE foo TO my_role
```

Deny privilege to create new relationship types on a specified database to a role.

```
REVOKE GRANT CREATE NEW PROPERTY NAMES ON DATABASE bar FROM my_role
```

Revoke the grant privilege to create new property names on a specified database from a role.

```
GRANT NAME MANAGEMENT ON HOME DATABASE TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to create labels, relationship types, and property names on the home database to a role.

```
GRANT ALL ON DATABASE baz TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to access, create and drop indexes and constraints, create new labels, types and property names on a
specified database to a role.

```
GRANT SHOW TRANSACTION (*) ON DATABASE foo TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to list transactions and queries from all users on a specified database to a role.

```
DENY TERMINATE TRANSACTION (user1, user2) ON DATABASES * TO my_role
```

Deny privilege to kill transactions and queries from user1 and user2 on all databases to a role.

```
REVOKE GRANT TRANSACTION MANAGEMENT ON HOME DATABASE FROM my_role
```

Revoke the granted privilege to list and kill transactions and queries from all users on the home database from a role.

cards.title: (★) Role management privileges
cards.body:
```
GRANT CREATE ROLE ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Grant the privilege to create roles to a role.

```
GRANT RENAME ROLE ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Grant the privilege to rename roles to a role.

```
GRANT DROP ROLE ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Grant the privilege to delete roles to a role.

```
DENY ASSIGN ROLE ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Deny the privilege to assign roles to users to a role.

```
DENY REMOVE ROLE ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Deny the privilege to remove roles from users to a role.

```
REVOKE DENY SHOW ROLE ON DBMS FROM my_role
```

Revoke the denied privilege to show roles from a role.

```
GRANT ROLE MANAGEMENT ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Grant all privileges to manage roles to a role.

cards.title: (%E2%98%85)%20User%20management%20privileges
cards.body: %60%60%60%0AGRANT%20CREATE%20USER%20ON%20DBMS%20TO%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AGrant%20the%20privilege%20to%20create%20users%20to%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AGRANT%20RENAME%20USER%20ON%20DBMS%20TO%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AGrant%20the%20privilege%20to%20rename%20users%20to%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0ADENY%20ALTER%20USER%20ON%20DBMS%20TO%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ADeny%20the%20privilege%20to%20alter%20users%20to%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AREVOKE%20SET%20PASSWORDS%20ON%20DBMS%20FROM%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ARevoke%20the%20granted%20and%20denied%20privileges%20to%20alter%20users'%20passwords%20from%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AREVOKE%20GRANT%20SET%20USER%20STATUS%20ON%20DBMS%20FROM%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ARevoke%20the%20granted%20privilege%20to%20alter%20the%20account%20status%20of%20users%20from%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AGRANT%20SET%20USER%20HOME%20DATABASE%20ON%20DBMS%20TO%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AGrant%20the%20privilege%20alter%20the%20home%20database%20of%20users%20to%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AGRANT%20DROP%20USER%20ON%20DBMS%20TO%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AGrant%20the%20privilege%20to%20delete%20users%20to%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AREVOKE%20DENY%20SHOW%20USER%20ON%20DBMS%20FROM%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0ARevoke%20the%20denied%20privilege%20to%20show%20users%20from%20a%20role.%0A%0A%60%60%60%0AGRANT%20USER%20MANAGEMENT%20ON%20DBMS%20TO%20my_role%0A%60%60%60%0A%0AGrant%20all%20privileges%20to%20manage%20users%20to%20a%20role.

cards.title: (★) Database management privileges
cards.body:
```
GRANT CREATE DATABASE ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Grant the privilege to create databases to a role.

```
REVOKE DENY DROP DATABASE ON DBMS FROM my_role
```

Revoke the denied privilege to delete databases from a role.

```
DENY DATABASE MANAGEMENT ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Deny all privileges to manage database to a role.

cards.title: (★) Privilege management privileges
cards.body:
```
GRANT SHOW PRIVILEGE ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Grant the privilege to show privileges to a role.

```
DENY ASSIGN PRIVILEGE ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Deny the privilege to assign privileges to roles to a role.

```
REVOKE GRANT REMOVE PRIVILEGE ON DBMS FROM my_role
```

Revoke the granted privilege to remove privileges from roles from a role.

```
REVOKE PRIVILEGE MANAGEMENT ON DBMS FROM my_role
```

Revoke all granted and denied privileges for manage privileges from a role.

cards.title: (★) DBMS privileges
cards.body:
```
GRANT ALL ON DBMS TO my_role
```

Grant privilege to perform all role management, user management, database management and privilege management to a role.

cards.title: ★ Note
cards.body: (★) Functionality available in Neo4j Enterprise Edition.
